content: it s assembled take some garden wire and cut a length that is almost 3 times the length of the full arm span of your orangutan do the same with the legs and feet and cut another piece of wire that is also almost 3 times the length of the leg span keep both of these pieces of wire bent back and forth as shown in the pictures © 2021 hb crafts all rights reserved this pattern is for personal use only 13 hannah bickerstaff - @hannahb_crafts take the piece of wire for the arms and with the bent end of wire insert it into one of the hands using the tail of the hand take a tapestry needle and pass the yarn through both sides of the hand multiple times in order to attach the wire loop to the inside use the needle to feel around and make sure you pass the yarn on both sides of the wire so that it is firmly attached take the two ends of the wire and pass them through one of the arms i start with the left arm you can unbend your wire to make this easier enter through the open end of the arm and exit through the magic ring slide the arm along to meet the hand but don t attach yet © 2021 hb crafts all rights reserved this pattern is for personal use only 14 hannah bickerstaff - @hannahb_crafts stuff through the wrist opening of the arm use something long and thin like a pencil or scissors to get the stuffing as far down as possible and on all sides of the wire stuff lightly as you want the arm to be bendable don t worry if it s a bit lumpy the fur will cover any imperfections attach the arm to the hand using the long tail of the arm make sure the wider part of the arm is facing the opposite direction to the thumb of the hand this makes the droopy elbow shape that orangutans have insert the two wire ends between row 24 and 25 of the body and make sure it s in the centre of the side of the body bring the two wire ends out in the same row in the centre of the other side you may need to do this one at a time pull the wire tight so the arm is tight against the body bend the wire back again so that the part sticking out is about the same length as the other arm and hand make this bend as small as possible as it needs to go through the right arm s magic ring along with the other end of the wire © 2021 hb crafts all rights reserved this pattern is for personal use only 15 hannah bickerstaff -
